meanings.definition: To outwit or outsmart through cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outintrigue her opponent in the chess match.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outintrigue his friends in games.
meanings.sent3: The detective's ability to outintrigue the suspect led to a surprising revelation.
meanings.sent4: Her plan to outintrigue the villain was like a carefully crafted puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The spy's mission was to outintrigue the enemy and gather valuable information.

meanings.definition: To surpass in intrigue or scheming.
meanings.sent1: The cunning fox was able to outintrigue the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The master spy knew how to outintrigue his rivals.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to outintrigue the clever squirrel in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outintrigue her opponents was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trickery was so great that he could outintrigue anyone.

meanings.definition: The act of outwitting or outsmarting someone through cunning or deceit.
meanings.sent1: His outintrigue of the con artist saved many people from being scammed.
meanings.sent2: The outintrigue of the spy was legendary in the intelligence community.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a hilarious outintrigue between two rival comedians.
meanings.sent4: The outintrigue of the detective was like a plot twist in a mystery novel.
meanings.sent5: Her outintrigue of the bully made her a hero among her classmates.
